unnormalised: **Automotive: Navigating New Traffic Regulations in Mumbai**
normalised: Automotive: Navigating New Traffic Regulations in Mumbai

unnormalised: Mumbai drivers, are you up-to-date with the latest traffic regulations? The Mumbai Traffic Police, in collaboration with IIT Bombay, has rolled out several key changes effective 01/01/2024. These aim to improve traffic flow and reduce accidents on our busy streets.
normalised: Mumbai drivers, are you up to date with the latest traffic regulations? The Mumbai Traffic Police, in collaboration with I I T Bombay, has rolled out several key changes effective first january two thousand and twenty four. These aim to improve traffic flow and reduce accidents on our busy streets.

unnormalised: One major change involves revised speed limits on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link. The maximum permissible speed is now 70 kmph during the day (07:00 hrs to 22:00 hrs) and 50 kmph at night.
normalised: One major change involves revised speed limits on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link. The maximum permissible speed is now seventy kilometer per hour during the day (zero seven hundred hours to twenty two hundred hours) and fifty kilometer per hour at night.

unnormalised: Furthermore, fines for violations like jumping signals near CSMT have been increased. Expect to shell out Rs. 2000 for repeated offences. "We're taking a zero-tolerance approach," says DCP Verma.
normalised: Furthermore, fines for violations like jumping signals near C S M T have been increased. Expect to shell out rupees two thousand for repeated offences. "We're taking a zero-tolerance approach," says D C P Verma.

unnormalised: Also, remember that the mandatory use of rear seatbelts is now being strictly enforced as of 15/03/2024. This is particularly important for family trips, especially during festivals like Diwali. Ignorance of these rules won't be an excuse! Stay safe, Mumbaikars!
normalised: Also, remember that the mandatory use of rear seatbelts is now being strictly enforced as of fifteenth march two thousand and twenty four. This is particularly important for family trips, especially during festivals like Diwali. Ignorance of these rules won't be an excuse! Stay safe, Mumbaikars!
